summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 regarding coordination between law enforcement and a prosecutor's office to run background checks on a list of potential witnesses for a case. The emails discuss obtaining records for individuals, formatting issues, and requesting additional information about the witnesses.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Mentioned as a point of contact and potentially as a witness on the list; appears to be part of a joint task force.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Listed as a potential testifying witness; works at the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: Both are involved in the legal/law enforcement process regarding witness checks for a case, indicating coordination between investigative and prosecutorial roles.

events.title: Witness background check coordination
events.description: Email exchange regarding running background checks (Accurint/Ejustice/NCIC queries) on a list of potential witnesses for a case.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

events.title: Initial witness list request
events.description: Initial email sent with a list of potential testifying witnesses, requesting rap sheets to be run by mid-week.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email chain involves coordination to run background checks on a list of 20 potential testifying witnesses for a case.
The checks include Accurint/Ejustice queries and NCIC records, indicating a formal law enforcement investigation.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is listed as a potential witness, suggesting prosecutorial involvement.
The correspondence highlights inter-agency collaboration between the NYPD/FBI task force and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The emails are dated October 2021, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to the case at that time.
